name: Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Alexandria

reviews.text: We stayed overnight for my birthday and wish we could have stayed longer. The staff was friendly and helpful and eager to please. They offer a free shuttle to the Metro (even before and after check in and check out), so we never had to drive in the city which was so nice. The free breakfast was amazing and the price was outstanding. The bed was amazing and we had a great night's sleep. Not to mention the free parking, which is hard to find in the NOVA area. This is our go to hotel now for Washington DC trips.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this facility from March 17 to March 24. as we toured The US capital region.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home

reviews.text: We are from a town about an hours drive north west of Toronto, Ontario.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facility and services were above our expectations.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay for Cherry Blossom Event; Convenient Location!

reviews.text: All of the staff we met/encountered were friendly and willing to please. The General Manager visited us during morning breakfast and evening reception for conversation and feedback. He was always interested in our activities and comments, and shared things about himself too. (once he drove the shuttle)
reviews.title: Five star rating for three star prices. Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed at this hotel a couple weeks ago and absolutely loved it. They have a free shuttle that takes you to the subway station and the line it drops you off at is a direct route to the Museums and Arlington. This hotel was very clean, offering free breakfast and dinner. I loved the bed at this hotel it was extremely comfortable and the staff was very nice.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel for Sightseeing in DC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back and it was a great experience. Manager was very accomodating in regards to our dog. From check in, to check out it was a great experience. Staff professional and curtious, Charles T. behind the bar was a professional and accomodating. Food provided was extrememly appreciated. If you are going to Wasington to tour the sites make sure to check out this great destination. I will definetly return to this hotel the next time we come to the area.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!!!

reviews.text: Norman K.
reviews.title: WOW - A one bedroom apartment in a hotel!

reviews.text: Canada
reviews.title: Comfortable,clean,service excellent

reviews.text: On our recent Spring Break visit to Washington, D.C., we decided to NOT stay in the D.C. area, because all of the traffic congestion and the hotels prices were not friendly. With the assistance of our travel agent, he was able to snag us a hotel with a great price, which was The Hawthorne Suites in Alexandria, Virginia. From the outside, I was like “ol boy, what will this be like?” When we walked in and received smiles from the young man and woman at the Front Desk, we knew that we had made a great choice.
reviews.title: Nice home away from home

reviews.text: This was an excellent room and great price! The kitchen helped our family of four cut back on eating out expenses, and the continental breakfasts were plentiful and changed a little bit every day. We stayed for five days, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The shuttle was convenient, and the hotel is in a good location...close to the Metro station, shopping, and restaurants.
reviews.title: Spring Break Stay, March 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Washington DC for the Cherry Blossom Festival, and wanted to stay near the city, close to the Metro. This hotel is a fine value and suited our purpose perfectly, which was also our experience with this chain in another state.
reviews.title: The Little Hotel That Could

reviews.text: The location is one Metro stop out from the inviting (but much more expensive) King Street area in Alexandria. The free shuttle service was very reliable in getting us to the Metro, so that you can access everything this city has to offer. The property is in an area of apartment buildings (which I suspect is what the building once was, as the accommodations are VERY spacious and quiet). You can't walk to restaurants/etc. as you would in old Alexandria; in fact, sometimes no sidewalk exists. So plan accordingly.
reviews.title: very family friendly

reviews.text: We found the free breakfast to be very satisfactory, with something different every morning during our four day stay. The breakfast/bar area is very pleasant. Staff was always friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Bad first impression

reviews.text: We could see that staying in a competitor's hotel in old Alexandria was more convenient, but we checked the rates and discovered that the rooms there were $100/night more. Save your money for more fun things to do in this city, and stay at this hotel!
reviews.title: Great price but keep looking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel online and arrived at 6 a.m. after taking a red-eye from LA. We did a bit of sightseeing in DC and thought we'd try to check in early as we were more tired than we thought. Wow! Not only did they allow us to check in 3 hours early but they upgraded us to a suite. Super, super front desk people!
reviews.title: Great Staff and Comfortable Room

reviews.text: Our room was on the top floor and so quiet! It had a separate bedroom with a flat-screen plus another flat-screen in the living room. There was a full-kitchen and dining room table for six. More than we needed but it sure made our stay feel luxurious! The bed was super comfy and linens were crisp and clean.
reviews.title: Best Guest Service and Medical Assistance to Boot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free breakfast is better than most although a bit crowded when the hotel is full. The only downside was that it's not near anything you can walk to. Old Town Alexandria is about a 20 minute drive away with traffic but if you're going to DC it's wonderful as there is a free shuttle to the Van Dorn station and that makes much more sense than trying to drive in downtown Washington.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!!

reviews.text: The absolute best was the staff - not one staff member hesitated to say hello! It was wonderful!
reviews.title: Good quality at a very good price

reviews.text: This first stay at Hawthorn Suites, Alexandria, in April 2012 made converts of us. We'll never stay anywhere else in the DC area. These friendly folks could write the book on customer service. Great value includes the kitchenette, shuttles to shopping, dining, and metro every day, as well as free cocktail hour and complimentary dinner Monday through Thursday (DELICIOUS home-cooked style fare) and a much better breakfast buffet than a lot of other places in this price range. They even do decent breakfast buffet on weekends, not just empty carbs. Besides all that, my wife had a medical emergency in the parking lot shortly after we arrived, and three or four staff members were on the spot with assistance before we could snap our fingers. Simply amazing. We felt like family with the staff by the time we left.
reviews.title: Took a chance on this hotel - definitely would not stay here again

aka: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Alexandria Hotel
